video_details.title: Git for Professionals Tutorial - Tools & Concepts for Mastering Version Control with Git
video_details.description:
Git has the power to make you a better software developer. But you'll have to go beyond the basic "commit, push, pull" to use it effectively! In this course, we'll look at some of the more advanced concepts and tools to make you more productive and confident with Git.

This course focuses on using Git with the command line.

✏️ This course was created by Tobias Günther from Tower. You can download Tower's Git desktop UI here: https://www.git-tower.com

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (00:00) Introduction
⌨️ (00:52) Hosted by Tower
⌨️ (01:27) The perfect commit
⌨️ (08:07) Branching strategies
⌨️ (17:16) Pull requests
⌨️ (24:07) Merge conflicts
⌨️ (33:48) Merge vs. rebase
⌨️ (40:05) The Advanced Git Kit: https://www.git-tower.com/learn/git/advanced-git-kit/

Correction:
23:37 Do NOT create a pull request to the Rails repo. This is just a demonstration and every frivolous PR creates extra work for their volunteer team. 

❤️ Support for this channel comes from our friends at Scrimba – the coding platform that's reinvented interactive learning: https://scrimba.com/freecodecamp

comments.author: @tdew11
comments.text: Your voice was so relaxing it put me to sleep but when I woke up I knew how rebasing works, so thank you!

comments.author: @architjain6749
comments.text: "You can live a happy Git life just using merge", I felt it!

comments.author: @fireballgfx
comments.text: I was not aware of the -p parameter who give me the ability to add only a specific part to the staging area.

comments.author: @josephgutierrez8430
comments.text: 40 minutes sounds like a long time, but it was all jam packed with legitimate information and no fluff. Great video. Watched the whole thing and didn't even notice the time.

comments.author: @iTor
comments.text: I closed my eyes for a moment there and I believe it was truly Christoph Waltz teaching me about Git.

comments.author: @braulioandre2918
comments.text: I've just realized I didn't know Git at all lol. Thank so much for this.

comments.author: @talkohavy
comments.text:
I consider myself as pretty profficiant with git,
yet I'm doing this thing where i'm occasionally revisiting known technologies to maybe learn some new things.
Anyhow, just I wanted to say that this 40-minutes long video was ALL WORTH IT just for the sake of learning about the git add with the -p flag to only mark some parts of a file to be included in the commit :) Love it! definitely gonna use it in the future♥ Thank you!

summary.title: Git for Professionals Tutorial - Tools & Concepts for Mastering Version Control with Git
summary.summary: This course focuses on using Git with the command line. You can download Tower's Git desktop UI here: https://www.git-tower.com/learn/git/advanced-git-kit. Christoph Waltz is the founder of the Git. er team. He gave a 40-minute talk on how to use Git. The talk was streamed live on the Scrimba channel.
